page.title: 01Terrington St Clement
page.content: Terrington St Clement is the largest parish in Norfolk, although due to its situation it is relatively sparsely populated and still a village which has no well defined pattern. A considerable area of the parish has been reclaimed from the Wash over the centuries and the succession of banks shows the progress of this work. The predominant occupations are agriculture and horticulture on the very fertile land, these producing potatoes corn and sugarbeet, and salad vegetables and fruit. The village contains the site of one of the national experimental husbandry farms. There are now a number of small local industries and two nationally known ones are Tony Clements African Violets and Tony Hodgsons Wrough Ironworks.
